Plasma¶

Plasma Module¶

fabry.plasma.plasma.calculate_line_profile(wavelength, w0, Ti, vel, theta, mu)¶

Calculates the Gaussian line shape for a given set of parameters

Parameters

  • wavelength (np.ndarray) – wavelength array

  • w0 (float) – central wavelength

  • Ti (float) – temperature of emitting species

  • vel (float) – toroidal velocity in m/s

  • theta (float) – angle of torodial velocity to line of sight

  • mu (float) – relative mass in amu

Returns

gaussian line shape

Return type

np.ndarray

fabry.plasma.plasma.calculate_pcx_chord_emission(impact_factor, Ti, w0, mu, Lnu, Vouter, rmax=40.0, nr=101, nlambda=2000, Lne=2.5, R_outer=35)¶

Calculates PCX emission with only the outer boundary spinning for a given impact factor

Parameters

  • impact_factor (float) – impact factor for chord

  • Ti (float) – ion temperature in eV

  • w0 (float) – central wavelength

  • mu (float) – mass in amu

  • Lnu (float) – momentum diffusion length

  • Vouter (float) – velocity in m/s for outer boundary

  • rmax (float) – end of the plasma

  • nr (int) – number of radial points to integrate chord with

  • nlambda (int) – number of wavelength points

  • Lne (float) – density gradient scale length at rmax

  • R_outer (float) – velocity at outer boundary

Returns

(np.ndarray, np.ndarray) wavelength and spectrum

Return type

tuple

fabry.plasma.plasma.calculate_r_theta_x_from_impact_factor(impact_factor, rmax=150.0, npts=101)¶

Calculates the radius array, theta array, and the distance along a chord at the specified impact factor

Parameters

  • impact_factor (float) – impact factor of the chord

  • rmax (float) – max radius to include in chord

  • npts (int) – number of points to use

Returns

(np.ndarray, np.ndarray, np.ndarray) r, theta, x

Return type

tuple

fabry.plasma.plasma.density_profile(r, r_edge, gradient_length_scale)¶

Calculates the electron density profile

Parameters

  • r (Union[np.ndarray, float]) – radii to calculate profile on

  • r_edge (float) – edge of the electron density profile

  • gradient_length_scale (float) – length scale of the gradient at r_edge

Returns

electron density profile as a function of r

Return type

np.ndarray

fabry.plasma.plasma.linear_Ti_profile(r, Ti_center, Ti_edge, r_edge)¶

Calculates a linear Ti profile at the radii r

Parameters

  • r (Union[float, np.ndarray]) – radius or radius array to calculate Ti

  • Ti_center (float) – Ti at r=0

  • Ti_edge (float) – Ti at r=r_edge

  • r_edge (float) – Edge of the plasma where Ti(r=r_edge)=Ti_ege

Returns

Ti at r=r with the same shape as r

fabry.plasma.plasma.pcx_couette_velocity_profile(r, mom_dif_length, R_inner, R_outer, V_inner, V_outer)¶

Calculates the torodial velocity profile for PCX

Parameters

  • r (Union[np.ndarray, float]) – radii to calculate profile on

  • mom_dif_length (float) – momentum diffusion length scale

  • R_inner (float) – Radius of inner boundary

  • R_outer (float) – Radius of outer boundary

  • V_inner (float) – Velocity at inner boundary

  • V_outer (float) – Velocity at outer boundary

Returns

torodial velocity profile as a function of r

Return type

np.ndarray

fabry.plasma.plasma.pcx_velocity_profile(r, mom_dif_length, R_outer, V_outer, V_offset)¶

Calculates the toroidal velocity profile with no inner boundary for PCX

Parameters

  • r (Union[np.ndarray, float]) – raddi to calculate profile on

  • mom_dif_length (float) – momentum diffusion length scale

  • R_outer (float) – Radii for outer boundary

  • V_outer (float) – Velocity at outer boundary

  • V_offset (float) – Offset velocity applied to whole profile to account for any erros in the diagnostic

Returns

torodial velocity profile as a function of r

Return type

np.ndarray

fabry.plasma.plasma.pcx_vfd_velocity_profile(r, r_anode, V_max)¶

Calculates the toroidal velocity profile for VFD on PCX

Parameters

  • r (Union[np.ndarray, float]) – radii to calculate profile on

  • r_anode (float) – location of anodes, assumed location of peak profile starting

  • V_max (float) – maximum velocity at r_anode

Returns

torodial velocity profile as a function of r

Return type

np.ndarray

fabry.plasma.plasma.radiance_from_profiles(x, w0, Ti, V_adjusted, amp, mu=39.948, nlambda=2048, test_plot=False)¶

Calculates radiance for a plasma chord given profiles and position along the chord

Parameters

  • x (np.ndarray) – position along the chord

  • w0 (float) – central wavelength

  • V_adjusted (np.ndarray) – toroidal velocity array but adjusted with the dot product with the chord vector

  • amp (np.ndarray) – emissivity amplitude along the chord

  • mu (float) – relative mass of the ion

  • nlambda (int) – number of wavelengths to calculate

Returns

wavelength and radiance as a function of wavelength for the chord

Return type

Tuple(np.ndarray, np.ndarray)

fabry.plasma.plasma.vfd_chord(impact_factor, Ti_args, V_args, ne_args, w0=487.98634, rmax=40.0, nr=100, nlambda=2048, mu=39.948, test_plot=False)¶

Calculate radiance for a chord from a PCX volumetric flow drive plasma

Parameters

  • impact_factor (float) – closest distance the chord is from the origin

  • Ti_args (List) – List containing args for Ti profile

  • V_args (List) – List containing args for V profile

  • ne_args (List) – List containing args for density profile

  • w0 (float) – central wavelength

  • rmax (float) – radius of the edge of the plasma

  • nr (int) – number of radii to use in calculation

  • nlambda (int) – number of wavelength to use in calculation

  • mu (float) – mass of ion in amu

  • test_plot (bool) – create a test plot if True

Returns

radiance for modeled chord

Return type

np.ndarray

fabry.plasma.plasma.vfd_density_profile(r, r_anode)¶

Calculate volumetric flow density profile model

Parameters

  • r (np.ndarray) – radii to calculate density on

  • r_anode (float) – radius of the anodes

Returns

density array

Return type

np.ndarray

Argon Plasma Solver Module¶

This module contains a few different MultiNest plasma solvers.

fabry.plasma.argon_plasma_solver.py.w0¶

wavelength for the Ar II ion line

fabry.plasma.argon_plasma_solver.py.mu¶

mass of argon in amu

fabry.plasma.argon_plasma_solver.py.no_vel_solver(output_folder, Fpost, Lpost, dpost, resume=True, test_plot=False)¶

MultiNest solver for argon with no velocity shift

Parameters

  • output_folder (str) – path to folder for input and output folders

  • Fpost (np.ndarray) – posterior results for the finesse

  • Lpost (np.ndarray) – posterior results for the camera focal length

  • dpost (np.ndarray) – posterior results for the etalon spacing

  • resume (bool) – resume calculation if True, default=True

  • test_plot (bool) – make a test plot of prior intstead of solving, default=False

fabry.plasma.argon_plasma_solver.py.const_vel_solver(output_folder, Fpost, Lpost, dpost, resume=True, test_plot=False)¶

MultiNest solver for argon with a constant velocity shift

Parameters

  • output_folder (str) – path to folder for input and output folders

  • Fpost (np.ndarray) – posterior results for the finesse

  • Lpost (np.ndarray) – posterior results for the camera focal length

  • dpost (np.ndarray) – posterior results for the etalon spacing

  • resume (bool) – resume calculation if True, default=True

  • test_plot (bool) – make a test plot of prior intstead of solving, default=False

fabry.plasma.argon_plasma_solver.py.profile_vel_solver(output_folder, Fpost, Lpost, dpost, resume=True, test_plot=False)¶

MultiNest solver for argon with a PCX-U torodial velocity with only outer drive

Parameters

  • output_folder (str) – path to folder for input and output folders

  • Fpost (np.ndarray) – posterior results for the finesse

  • Lpost (np.ndarray) – posterior results for the camera focal length

  • dpost (np.ndarray) – posterior results for the etalon spacing

  • resume (bool) – resume calculation if True, default=True

  • test_plot (bool) – make a test plot of prior intstead of solving, default=False

Argon Chord Solver Module¶

This module contains a chord solver for VFD argon plasmas on PCX

fabry.plasma.argon_chord_solver.py.w0¶

wavelength for the Ar II ion line

fabry.plasma.argon_chord_solver.py.mu¶

mass of argon in amu

fabry.plasma.argon_chord_solver.py.pcx_vfd_model(r, b, Ti_params, V_params, ne_params, delta_d, amp, L, d, F, rmax=40.0)¶

Simple wrapper for modeling chords on PCX for VFD experiments

Parameters

  • r (np.ndarray) – array of pixel radius locations

  • b (float) – impact factor

  • Ti_params (List) – List containing args for Ti profile

  • V_params (List) – List containing args for V profile

  • ne_params (List) – List containing args for ne profile

  • delta_d (float) – change in etalon spacing in mm

  • amp (float) – amplitude

  • L (float) – focal length in pixels

  • d (float) – etalon spacing in mm

  • F (float) – etalon finesse

  • rmax (float) – max radius in the plasma to model

calculate_delta_d(velocity_offset):

Calculates delta d (in mm) for a velocity offset (m/s)

Parameters

velocity_offset (float) – offset velocity in n/s

Returns

delta d in mm

Return type

float

prior(cube, ndim, nparams):

Transforms prior hypercube to physical units

Parameters

  • cube (List) – hypercube to transform to physical units

  • ndim – Not used, MultiNest asks for it

  • nparams (int) – number of parameters, can be bigger than cube dimension I believe

argon_multi_image_solver_fixed_Lnu(output_folder, calib_posterior, image_data, resume=True, test_plot=False):

Runs MultiNest solver for multiple chords in a PCX Ar plasma with a fixed Lnu.

Parameters

  • output_folder (str) – output folder to store multinest files

  • calib_posterior (np.ndarray) – calibration equally weighted posterior samples

  • image_data (tuple) – Tuple containing (r, sig, std, impact_factor) for the images to be analyzed

  • resume (bool) – Resume multinest solver if True, default=True

  • test_plot (bool) – Runs test plot sampling from prior instead of running solver, default=False

Check Argon Chord Solver Module¶

This module contains functions for checking the validity of the argon_chord_solver

fabry.plasma.check_argon_chord_solver.py.w0¶

wavelength for the Ar II ion line

fabry.plasma.check_argon_chord_solver.py.mu¶

mass of argon in amu

check_const_Lnu_solver(output_folder, calib_posterior, image_data, n_samples=200):

Creates many plots to check validity of chord solver

Parameters

  • output_folder (str) – output folder where MultiNest files are stored

  • calib_posterior (np.ndarray) – calibration posterior

  • image_data (Tuple) – Tuple containing r, signal, signal error, and impact factor for the image data

  • n_samples (int) – number of posterior samples to use for fit plotting

joint_marginal_plot(xpost, ypost, xlabel, ylabel, savefig=False, fname=None, block=False):

Plot joint marginal distribution with marginals for x and y posteriors

Parameters

  • xpost (np.ndarray) – posterior values for the x axis

  • ypost (np.ndarray) – posterior values for the y axis

  • xlabel (str) – x axis label

  • ylabel (str) – y axis label

  • savefig (bool) – True if the figure should be saved

  • fname (str) – filename to save figure to

  • block (bool) – block script while showing figure. User must close figure to continue

Returns

Tuple with figure and axes

Return type

Tuple

marginal_plot(posterior, xlabel, ylabel, savefig=False, fname=None, block=False):

Create a marginal posterior plot for posterior

Parameters

  • posterior (np.ndarray) – posterior to plot

  • xlabel (str) – x axis label

  • ylabel (str) – y axis label

  • savefig (bool) – True if the figure should be saved

  • fname (str) – filename to save figure to

  • block (bool) – block script while showing figure. User must close figure to continue.

Returns

Tuple containing figure and axes

Return type

Tuple

calculate_multi_models(r, impact_factors, vel_offsets, L, d, F, Lnu, cube, nlambda=2000, nr=101, rmax=40.0, r_anode=32.0):

Calculates forward models for the given parameters

Parameters

  • r (List) – List containing r arrays for each image

  • impact_factors (List) – List containing impact factors for each image

  • vel_offsets (List) – velocity offsets to account for etalon variation in time

  • L (float) – camera focal length in pixels

  • d (float) – etalon spacing in mm

  • F (float) – etalon finesse

  • Lnu (float) – momentum diffusion length

  • cube (list) – posterior samples for each parameter

  • nlambda (int) – number of wavelengths to calculate with

  • nr (int) – number of radial points to model chord with

  • rmax (float) – edge of the plasma

  • r_anode (float) – radius location of the anode tip

Returns

List of values for each chord location

Return type

List

calculate_percentile_ranges(data, levels):

Calculates the percentage ranges that include the level around the mean. Generally used for finding 1 sigma, 2 sigma, and 3 sigma assuming Gaussian distribution.

Parameters

  • data (np.ndarray) – data to calculate percentile ranges

  • levels (List) – List of levesl to calcualte ranges on. Should be in % and be between 0 and 100

Returns

dictionary with keys being the levels

Return type

dict
